<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/10/ces-tech-playground-automakers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
<em>Cars 4</em> Is About to Be Insane
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A futuristic car " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NjkzMTAyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, CES in Las Vegas was a parade of transportation-focused tech that made the Tesla Model 3 look like a horse-drawn wagon. The major themes...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Flying cars</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hyundai and Uber announced a partnership <a href="https://www.axios.com/hyundai-unveils-flying-taxi-for-uber-b4cb9d40-d7c3-4505-8262-5a3697f1c533.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to build</a> a flying rideshare network.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/01/08/toyota-experiments-smart-cities-hyundai-air-taxis?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">air taxi network</a></span><span> will let you hail a four-passenger, four-propeller flying vehicle through the Uber app for trips up to </span><span><a href="https://nypost.com/2020/01/08/flying-cars-you-can-hail-among-vehicles-debuting-at-ces/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">60 miles</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While Uber’s teamed up with scores of aerospace companies in its pursuit to decimate whatever the yellow cab of the skies is, this is the first time it’s tapped an automaker.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead: </strong>Uber + Hyundai want to launch commercial flights as soon as 2023.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Electric cars</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sony <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/10/sonys-concept-car-hyundais-flying-taxi-among-top-auto-debuts-at-ces.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">took gold</a>. We know Sony isn’t an automaker. But it’s Vegas—Britney proved there are no rules.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sony <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/8/21056404/sony-vision-s-electric-concept-prototype-first-look-ces-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debuted</a> an electric concept car called the <a href="https://www.wired.com/story/sony-concept-car-puts-entertainment-drivers-seat/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vision-S</a> chock full of entertainment specs like a 360-degree audio system and a panoramic front dashboard display.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Of note: </strong></span><span>Sony has no intention of using its PlayStation money to take on Toyota...or producing the Vision-S at all. It showcased the concept car to prove its utility for automakers, not threaten them.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Self-driving cars</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How do you make money from driverless cars when you don’t make driverless cars? You <a href="https://www.axios.com/everyones-piling-into-the-car-of-the-future-2cab4278-c0b9-40fd-ba46-1a30825bf3fc.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make things</a> for the people who don't have to drive anymore. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon is placing its Fire TV into backseat entertainment systems, starting with BMW and Fiat Chrysler.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>BMW debuted the X7 ZeroG Lounger, a seat perfectly crafted for the activity we all know will be popular in driverless cars...sleep. The zero-gravity seat tilts back to prime napping position. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With hot-button tech like virtual reality taking longer than expected to actually appeal to consumers, technologists are getting back to drop-off line basics with transportation innovations almost everyone can get behind (and not steer).</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/10/women-hold-majority-jobs-december?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Stood Out in the Jobs Report
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. economy added <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-job-growth-cools-in-december-but-labor-market-tight-idUSKBN1Z90E6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">145,000 jobs</a> in December, capping a year of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/09/economists-workers-labor-market-red-hot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strong growth</a> in the labor market.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The bigger news: </strong>For the first time since 2010, women held the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/women-overtake-men-as-majority-of-u-s-workforce-11578670615?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">majority</a> (50.04%) of nonfarm payroll positions in December. So where are women working? <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Education and health services: </strong></span><span>Women hold 77.3% of these jobs.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Services in general: </strong></span><span><span>Women hold 54% of jobs in the services sector, which accounts for 84% of all nonfarm payroll jobs.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Some industries women hadn’t always dominated: </strong></span><span><span>Women now make up 13.8% of mining and logging jobs, up from 12.6% a year ago.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“Women are working where jobs are growing,” <a href="https://twitter.com/BetseyStevenson/status/1215630545092337665?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> University of Michigan professor Betsey Stevenson. “Health care added more jobs in 2019 than 2018, while jobs [growth] slowed substantially in mining, construction, transportation & warehousing, and construction.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The picture gets darker if you look at <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-10/women-stand-out-in-otherwise-middling-u-s-december-jobs-report?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declining male participation</a> in the labor force, which has fallen to 89% from nearly 100% in the 1950s. </p>

<tr>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/10/tv-stats-make-gowow?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
TV Stats That Make You Go..."Wow"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Michael Scott looking pleased" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=402 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/XR9Dp54ZC4dji/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Michael Scott looking pleased" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/XR9Dp54ZC4dji/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/09/business/media/tv-shows-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first time</a> ever, there were more than 500 scripted television series in the U.S. in 2019...meaning 500+ failed attempts to top the cultural relevance of The CW’s <em>Dynasty </em>reboot.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>There were 532 comedies, dramas, and limited series broadcast or streamed in the U.S. last year, according to FX, <a href="https://wpde.com/news/entertainment/growth-in-number-of-tv-series-bananas-network-boss-says?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up 7%</a> from 2018.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thank the streamers.</strong> Netflix spent upwards of $15 billion on original content last year. Apple spent an estimated $120 million on one season of <em>The Morning Show </em>alone.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The number of scripted series climbed 52% from 2013, the year Netflix debuted </span><span><em>House of Cards</em></span><span> and effectively declared “en garde” on the streaming wars.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That year, streamers released 24 series. In 2018, they released 160, more than the output of both networks or basic cable. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> With consumers drowning in content, it’s getting harder for series to stand out. Expect more marquee deals from streamers (and cablers) hoping to capitalize on cult favorites like <em>The Handmaid’s Tale</em>, Shondaland, and <em>Watchmen</em>.</p>

Casper the Friendly Public Company

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Online mattrezzz retailer Casper Sleep <a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1598674/000104746920000166/a2240404zs-1.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a> on the NYSE yesterday under the ticker CSPR. <a href="https://www.axios.com/casper-ipo-mattress-48f9be2c-6298-4b6f-bdb0-85eba75c854a.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">To the numbers</a> we go:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Revenue: </strong></span><span>$312 million for the first nine months of 2019, up from $260 million in the same period last year.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Losses: </strong></span><span><span>$67 million, up from $64 million.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Valuation: </strong></span><span><span>Casper was </span></span><span><a href="https://news.crunchbase.com/news/mattress-retailer-casper-raises-100m-at-1-1b-valuation-amid-ipo-rumors/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worth $1.1 billion</a></span><span><span> last March. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today’s Casper looks a lot different from the pioneering direct-to-consumer mattress startup that sponsored every 2016 podcast. It’s expanded into brick-and-mortar with 60 retail locations in the U.S. and Canada, including <a href="https://dreamerybycasper.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Dreamery</a>, a “magical” place in New York City where you can pay to take a nap. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s also expanding its product line to tap into what it calls the “global sleep economy.” That includes bedroom products (lighting, sounds, scents), sleep services (meditation, digital apps), and sleep supplements (<a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/17/casper-cbd-gummies/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CBD gummies</a>). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the competition is <a href="https://twitter.com/web/status/1215713620207849473?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beyond fierce</a> and Casper earned tech company valuations on the private market. It'll have a lot to prove.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SATURDAY HEADLINES: CES EDITION
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s head back to Las Vegas, where the world’s most important consumer tech show just wrapped up. We’ll give you three real products that were unveiled at CES and a concept that Morning Brew may unveil at the show next year. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/11nuvoZGgSH3Ne/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Internet-connected socks</a></span><span> to monitor your daily steps</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A </span><span><a href="https://www.digitaltrends.com/cool-tech/weirdest-tech-ces-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">toilet paper delivery bot</a></span><span>

It showcased the concept car to prove its utility for automakers, not threaten them.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSelf-driving cars\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow do you make money from driverless cars when you don’t make driverless cars? You \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/everyones-piling-into-the-car-of-the-future-2cab4278-c0b9-40fd-ba46-1a30825bf3fc.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emake things\u003c/a\u003e for the people who don't have to drive anymore. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmazon is placing its Fire TV into backseat entertainment systems, starting with BMW and Fiat Chrysler.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBMW debuted the X7 ZeroG Lounger, a seat perfectly crafted for the activity we all know will be popular in driverless cars...sleep. The zero-gravity seat tilts back to prime napping position. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith hot-button tech like virtual reality taking longer than expected to actually appeal to consumers, technologists are getting back to drop-off line basics with transportation innovations almost everyone can get behind (and not steer).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Report\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. economy added \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-job-growth-cools-in-december-but-labor-market-tight-idUSKBN1Z90E6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e145,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e in December, capping a year of \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/09/economists-workers-labor-market-red-hot?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrong growth\u003c/a\u003e in the labor market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe bigger news: \u003c/strong\u003eFor the first time since 2010, women held the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/women-overtake-men-as-majority-of-u-s-workforce-11578670615?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajority\u003c/a\u003e (50.04%) of nonfarm payroll positions in December. So where are women working? \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEducation and health services: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWomen hold 77.3% of these jobs.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eServices in general: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWomen hold 54% of jobs in the services sector, which accounts for 84% of all nonfarm payroll jobs.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome industries women hadn’t always dominated: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWomen now make up 13.8% of mining and logging jobs, up from 12.6% a year ago.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003e“Women are working where jobs are growing,” \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/BetseyStevenson/status/1215630545092337665?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e University of Michigan professor Betsey Stevenson. “Health care added more jobs in 2019 than 2018, while jobs [growth] slowed substantially in mining, construction, transportation \u0026 warehousing, and construction.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe picture gets darker if you look at \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-10/women-stand-out-in-otherwise-middling-u-s-december-jobs-report?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeclining male participation\u003c/a\u003e in the labor force, which has fallen to 89% from nearly 100% in the 1950s. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/09/business/media/tv-shows-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst time\u003c/a\u003e ever, there were more than 500 scripted television series in the U.S. in 2019...meaning 500+ failed attempts to top the cultural relevance of The CW’s \u003cem\u003eDynasty \u003c/em\u003ereboot.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eThere were 532 comedies, dramas, and limited series broadcast or streamed in the U.S. last year, according to FX, \u003ca href=\"https://wpde.com/news/entertainment/growth-in-number-of-tv-series-bananas-network-boss-says?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup 7%\u003c/a\u003e from 2018.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThank the streamers.\u003c/strong\u003e Netflix spent upwards of $15 billion on original content last year. Apple spent an estimated $120 million on one season of \u003cem\u003eThe Morning Show \u003c/em\u003ealone.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe number of scripted series climbed 52% from 2013, the year Netflix debuted \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eHouse of Cards\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and effectively declared “en garde” on the streaming wars.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat year, streamers released 24 series.
